SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

sofya.ed.semantic
Class InstrumentationManager

java.lang.Object
  sofya.ed.semantic.InstrumentationManager

public final class InstrumentationManager
extends java.lang.Object

The instrumentation manager provides the interface to the adaptive instrumentation capabilities of a SemanticEventDispatcher. This interface is only available if the event dispatcher is operating using an AdaptiveEventSpecification.

The methods provided by this interface are dispatched asynchronously to avoid the possibility of deadlocking the event processing thread. As a consequence, calls will return immediately, though the calling thread may subsequently block normally if no new events are in the event queue prior to suspension of the target VM to transfer instrumentation updates.

Certain methods offer a parameter to specify whether the update should be synchronously applied. If true is specified for this parameter, it is guaranteed that between the time the relevant update method is called and the instrumentation update occurs in the target VM, no new events can reach the event queue to be dispatched to listeners. However, there may still be previous events pending in the queue that will be dispatched to listeners after the update request is received. This aspect of synchronous/asynchronous handling should not be confused with the issue of dispatch of the method calls themselves, which are always asynchronous! It is only relevant to the question of when updates are guaranteed to occur with respect to the visibility of other observable events occurring in the target VM.!

NOTE: Support for EDL is limited. In particular, do not use wildcards with any method on this API, as support has not yet been implemented (this will be addressed in future).

Version:
beta
Author:
Alex Kinneer

Nested Class Summary
static class InstrumentationManager.DetachingErrorHandler
          A detaching error handler logs the exception and then detaches the event dispatcher from the target program.
static class InstrumentationManager.ErrorHandler
          An error handler is invoked if an exception is raised while trying to execute an instrumentation update request.
static class InstrumentationManager.HaltingErrorHandler
          A halting error handler logs the exception and attempts to immediately terminate the target program.
static class InstrumentationManager.ResumingErrorHandler
          A resuming error handler simply logs the exception and attempts to continue observing the execution of the target program.

Field Detail

THREAD_NAME

public static final java.lang.String THREAD_NAME
Name of the thread created inside the target VM to handle requests to retrieve class bytecodes. Mostly randomly generated to minimize likelihood of name collisions with "real" threads.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

setErrorHandler

public void setErrorHandler(InstrumentationManager.ErrorHandler errorHandler)
Sets the error handler to be invoked if an exception occurs in a thread executing the update request.

An asynchronous dispatch model is used to execute update requests (even those that are synchronous with respect to the progress of the target program), so this mechanism is necessary to provide for proper exception handling associated with the update request.

The default error handler is the InstrumentationManager.ResumingErrorHandler.

Parameters:
errorHandler - Error handler to be invoked if an exception occurs in a thread executing an update request.

updateInstrumentation

public void updateInstrumentation()
Issues a request to immediately execute any pending instrumentation updates.

This method is dispatched asynchronously and returns immediately. As a consequence, it does not return any value or throw any exception to the caller. However, if there is an error processing the request, at some point in the future the error handler for this instrumentation manager will be invoked as a result of this call.

updateInstrumentation

public void updateInstrumentation(boolean synchronous)
Issues a request to execute any pending instrumentation updates.

This method is dispatched asynchronously and returns immediately. As a consequence, it does not return any value or throw any exception to the caller. However, if there is an error processing the request, at some point in the future the error handler for this instrumentation manager will be invoked as a result of this call.

Parameters:
synchronous - Specifies whether the update should occur immediately, as described in the overview for this API. A call to this method with synchronous equal to true is equivalent to calling updateInstrumentation().

detach

public void detach(java.lang.String key)
Completely detaches the event dispatcher from the monitored program.

Detaching the event dispatcher allows the monitored program to proceed normally, which greatly improves performance.

Use this method only if you are certain that you are no longer interested in monitoring the program in any way! It will not be possible to observe any further events after this method is called, with the exception of the following:

  • threadDeath events for any threads that are known at the time this method is called. The information available from the ThreadData objects delivered by these events is highly constrained. Note also that these events will be delivered at the termination of the program, and may not reflect the actual ordering of thread termination.
  • The systemExited event for the program.

At a future point in time, support may be added to re-attach to the monitored program.
